item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H6192-6193)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H6192-6193)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1499.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H6192-6194)
Mr. Pallone moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.fullName: Resident Commissioner Pierluisi, Pedro R. [D-PR-At Large]

summary.text:
Honors Dr. Robert Campbell for his lifelong devotion to children's health care. Congratulates Dr. Campbell and his colleagues on their extraordinary achievement in pediatric and orthopedic innovation.

Recognizes the Vertical Expandable Prosthetic Titanium Rib device which has saved the lives of many infants and children.

Calls on the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to continue to support and incentivize other medical advances to save children's lives threatened by rare disorders.

Honors Dr. Robert Campbell for his lifelong devotion to children's health care. Congratulates Dr. Campbell and his colleagues on their extraordinary achievement in pediatric and orthopedic innovation.

Recognizes the Vertical Expandable Prosthetic Titanium Rib device which has saved the lives of many infants and children.

bill.title: Honoring the achievements of Dr. Robert M. Campbell, Jr., to provide children with lifesaving medical care.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
